alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 9:46PM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low with embedded waves and an associated front will move over the panhandle Friday. Dry snow will spread from north to south across the panhandle. The snow will largely fall in two separate waves. A first, and weaker, wave will move through by early Friday morning. A brief lull may be possible Friday morning for some locations before a much stronger wave moves into the panhandle, bringing with it substantially more snow. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for parts of the northern and central inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening through early Saturday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 15 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau, Gustavus, and Glacier Bay. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult due to reduced visibility and blowing snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry snow will fall Thursday night resulting in moderate snow accumulations. A brief lull in the snow may occur Friday morning before the second, stronger, wave arrives. The greatest snowfall rates are expected with this second wave Friday afternoon through Friday night before rates begin to diminish early Saturday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau; Glacier Bay
